sandy.bounds.BSphere

type
class
The BSphere class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.

It creates a bounding sphere that contains the whole object

@example This example is taken from the Shape3D class. It is used in the updateBoundingVolumes() method: _oBSphere = BSphere.create( m_oGeometry.aVertex ); @author Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou @version 3.1 @author Niel Drummond - haXe port @author Russell Weir - haXe port @date 22.03.2006

Static Methods

create(p_aVertices : Array<sandy.core.data.Vertex>) : BSphere

parameters:
p_aVertices The vertices of the 3D object
returns:
A BSphere instance
Creates a bounding sphere that encloses a 3D object. This object's vertices are passed to the create method in the form of an Array. Very useful for clipping and thus performance!

Constructor

new()

Create a new BSphere instance.

Instance Variables

center : sandy.core.data.Point3D

position : sandy.core.data.Point3D

radius : Float

uptodate : Bool

Specify if this object is up to date or not. If false, you need to call its transform method to get its correct bounds in the desired frame.

Instance Methods

compute(p_aVertices : Array<sandy.core.data.Vertex>) : Void

parameters:
p_aVertices The vertices of the 3D object
Performs the actual computing of the bounding sphere's center and radius

distance(p_oPoint : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : Float

returns:
>0 if position is outside the sphere, <0 if inside, =0 if on the surface of the sphere
Returns the distance of a point from the surface.

reset() : Void

Reset the current bounding box to an empoty box with 0,0,0 as max and min values

resetFromBox(box : BBox) : Void

toString() : String

returns:
A String representing the bounding sphere
Returns a String represntation of the BSphere.

transform(p_oMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4) : Void

parameters:
p_oMatrix The transformation matrix
Applies the transformation that is specified in the Matrix4 parameter.
